If you’re considering a new Android tablet upgrade, and haven’t already jumped in yet, you might want to think about it now while the early launch deals are still live – you can score up to $120 off Galaxy S11 and as much as $150 off the Tab S11 Ultra with no trades or bundles needed (although you can stack these discounts when trading in).

You’re looking at the base variant of this laptop with 16GB RAM and 512GB SSD that typically goes for $1,250. Today’s deal at Walmart, however, takes $351 off its usual going rate, landing it back at the lowest price we first tracked for it last month. Dell, in case you’re wondering, currently has it for $1,100 with a relatively lighter deal. Head below for more details.

items.title: Scoop up three long sleeve polo shirts while they’re only $9 each (27% off)
items.summary:
PINSPARK Long Sleeve Polo Shirts (3-pack)

Buy for $27 (Reg. $37)

What we love

Now that fall is officially here, for many of us, this is when we start dressing a bit warmer. As the weather bounces between cool mornings to warmer days, I find long sleeve shirts give me a lot of flexibility since I can roll up the sleeves as needed. Today’s offer will stock your closet with three shirts at $9 a pop.

items.title: Make the most of precious kitchen cabinet space with Joseph Joseph’s large utensil organizer at $10.50 (Reg. $18)
items.summary:
Joseph Joseph DrawerStore Large Utensil Organizer

Buy for $10.50 (Reg. $18)

What we love

Joseph Joseph is one of those brands that is always coming up with new ways to get the most out of the space in your kitchen. This particular unit tackles utensils, allows you to store up to 48 pieces of cutlery in a compact and easy to access way.

items.title: A look at CoreWeave, whose financing strategy involves using GPUs as collateral for large loans, which enabled rapid expansion but resulted in $11.2B in debt (Rashi Shrivastava/Forbes)
items.summary:
Rashi Shrivastava / Forbes:
A look at CoreWeave, whose financing strategy involves using GPUs as collateral for large loans, which enabled rapid expansion but resulted in $11.2B in debt  —  A knack for creative financing and an enormous appetite for risk helped CoreWeave's Michael Intrator ride the AI data center boom to a $6.7 billion personal fortune.

items.title: Still live: Amazon just dropped the M4 Mac mini back down to $499
items.summary:
Amazon has now bought back its best price on the 16GB/512GB M4 Mac mini at $689 shipped. Regularly $799, this is $110 off and one of the better discounts we have tracked on the more affordable end of the lineup over the last few months. However, it has also dropped the most affordable 16GB/256GB config back down to $499 shipped as well.

items.title: This already-affordable desk chair mat with woven design now costs less at $27.50 Prime shipped
items.summary:
Delamu 48- by 36-inch Office Desk Chair Mat

Buy for $27.50 (Reg. $34)

What we love

If you want your desk chair to glide smoothly and worry less about scuffing your floors, a mat like this can help. Best of all, this one won’t break the bank. You’ll only need to set aside $27.50, which is a small price to pay in order to protect much more costly flooring. I really like the woven style here, which differentiates it from the bland clear plastic style that’s all too common.

items.title: Steam game removed after cryptostealer takes over $150K
items.summary: Steam has taken down a game containing malware that drained the cryptocurrency wallets belonging to hundreds of players, as reported earlier by Bleeping Computer. The free-to-play 2D platformer, titled BlockBlasters, took more than $150,000 from victims, including $32,000 from a streamer raising funds for their cancer treatment. In a post on X, malware tracker vx-underground […]

items.title: Jimmy Kimmel’s show will return after censorship outrage
items.summary: Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night talk show is returning on Tuesday after Disney pulled it off the air over comments made about the assassination of Charlie Kirk. Earlier this spring, Spigen unleashed one of its more compelling Apple Watch Bands. The now $22 Spigen Athlex band is in many ways a far more affordable take on Apple’s own Trail Loop and today as we are taking a look at its new WBF1 Alpine Loop-style band you can score on Amazon for $22 Prime shipped.

items.title: Bag two ratcheting leather belts with five micro-adjustments per inch, now $9.50 each (21% off)
items.summary:
Zitahli Ratcheting Leather Belts (2-pack)

Buy for $19 (Reg. $24)

What we love

I made the switch to ratcheting belts like these a couple years ago and I don’t think I’ll ever go back. The main reason is that they offer micro-adjustments that let you tweak sizing five times per inch. That makes them much more comfortable to wear, and discomfort was one of the main reasons I used to avoid belts.

items.title: This metal lamp brings AC, USB-A, and 20W Type-C charging to your nightstand for $20 (Save 46%)
items.summary:
Addtam Metal USB-C Bedside Table Lamp

Buy for $20 (Reg. $37)

What we love

This usually $37 lamp first arrived at Amazon about 3 months ago and is now just $20. Despite the reasonable price point, it actually has a metal build that’s outfitted with an AC outlet in addition to 20W Type-C and 18W USB-A ports. You can switch between three color temperatures as well.

We also have an ongoing all-time low on Google’s new Moonstone Pixel Buds Pro 2, a $400 price drop on the 2025 Razr Ultra flip phone, and the unlocked  S25 Edge at $400 off via Amazon. items.title: Haul it all in tomtoc’s spacious 40-liter 17.3-inch laptop travel backpack down at $70 (Save 20%)
items.summary:
tomtoc 40L 17.3-inch Laptop Travel Backpack

Buy for $70 (Reg. $88)

What we love

I made the switch to a bag like this earlier this year. I wanted to only haul one bag when I board a flight and this spacious bag can certainly help you do that. Much like the one I’m using, it sports a duffle bag style side opening so you can fill it like you would luggage. Around back you’ll find a slot for an up to 17.3-inch laptop as well, ensuring it can handle just about anything out there.

items.title: Don’t need a standing desk? This standard model delivers integrated lighting and AC outlets at $86 (Save 31%)
items.summary:
YITAHOME L-Shaped Desk with Power Station and LEDs

Buy for $86 (Reg. $124)

What we love

While we cover a lot of standing desk markdowns, some folks would rather stick with a traditional solution and we totally get that. This offering delivers loads of space with an L-shaped form factor that comfortably accomodate a few monitors. A couple of other notable perks include integrated LEDs and a power strip for quick access to AC outlets and a USB port.

items.title: This Anker Prime 200W 6-port USB-C charging station will power your desk setup for $56 today
items.summary:
Courtesy of Anker’s official Amazon storefront, you can score the brand’s Prime 200W 6-port USB-C charging station for $55.99 shipped. This multi-port charger typically goes for $80, so you’re looking at a 30% discount that takes $24 off its usual going rate. Today’s deal matches the lowest price we first tracked for this model as a Prime-exclusive offer shortly after its debut. More recently, it hit that price during the previous Prime Day sale, and it’s now back again at that same all-time low. Head below for more details.

items.title: Apple’s 1-meter 25W MagSafe charger just hit the best Amazon price of the year at $28
items.summary:
Apple somewhat quietly released a new 2025 MagSafe Charger last week. It is effectively the same thing as the 2024 model, just with official support for Qi2 – so it can deliver up to 25W of juice to more than just iPhone 16 and 17 devices. The new model comes in two sizes: 1-meter for $39 and the 2-meter model that is currently already on sale at just over $34. However, Amazon has dropped the 25W 2024 model Apple MagSafe Charger down its best price of the year at $27.90 with free shipping for Prime members  or in orders over $35.
